title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: brighouse ritz told to change name by london ritz hotel .
north yorkshire primary school with just 12 pupils to close .
one-punch killer blue horrobin starting an 11 year prison sentence .
police increase patrols after sheffield shooting .
plans to transform nhs services in england involve hospital closures or downgrading a & e with changes at huddersfield royal infirmary and dewsbury hospital .
one of north yorkshire 's biggest landfill sites will close when the county 's new waste incinerator opens nearby .

text: sidebottom to retire at end of season

documents.title: police issue fatal shooting car appeal
text: police issue fatal shooting car appeal

text: life-saving wife in cpr call for schools

documents.title: stilt plans passed for flood-hit store
text: stilt plans passed for flood-hit store

documents.title: our five top stories today
text: thanks for being with us today , live updates will continue throughout this evening and tonight .
before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
if you spot something happening where you live , which you think we should know about , you can always get in touch with us by email .
author: Oli Woodcock
BBC Local Live

documents.title: young girl found travelling alone on leeds bus
text: a young girl 's been found travelling alone on a bus into leeds city centre this afternoon .
officers were called to collect the child , who 's believed to be under the age of 11 , from the bus when it stopped in albion street at about 17:30 .
she 'd been found by the bus driver .
the girl did not speak much english and could not tell officers why she was on the bus , a police spokesman has said .
author: Charles Heslett
Journalist, BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: new market on darley street will put spotlight on bradford producers
text: local producers of food , crafts and arts will soon be given a chance to show their goods in a regular city centre market .
author: Bradford Telegraph and Argus

documents.title: woman 's cpr saves her husband 's life
text: woman 's cpr saves her husband 's life

documents.title: board games booming at sheffield library
text: a popular saturday morning board games session at ecclesfield library has now been extended until june due to the success of the scheme .

the sessions , run by imagination gaming , encourage children and families to come down and have a positive experience of their local library , as well as providing exciting activities , helping to connect communities together .
this event was a great success and very well attended .
lots of fun was had by all , including my own children .
it 's great to see ecclesfield library going from strength to strength ''
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: ritz hotel orders venue to change name
text: ritz hotel orders venue to change name

documents.title: did you hear a 'loud bang ' in crosland moor last night ? police are investigating reports
text: police were called to crosland moor last night after a resident reported a `` loud bang '' which sounded like a `` gun shot '' .
officers were called to college street after receiving the call from a concerned member of the public at about 21:30 .
they carried out a search of the area last night but no evidence was found to suggest a firearm had been discharged .
author: Huddersfield Examiner

documents.title: your evening weather forecast
text: windy this evening and overnight with some rain .
the rain will mainly affect the pennines where it will be heavy and persistent .
strong and gusty westerly winds and a minimum temperature of 7 deg c ( 45f ) .
early rain on wednesday will soon clear to the south and the strong westerly winds will ease .
bright with sunny spells and just the odd isolated shower .
temperature highs of 10c ( 50f )
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: listen : antarctic expedition for north yorkshire soldier
text: a north yorkshire soldier is among a group who 'll attempt to become the first all-female team to cross the antarctic unaided .
lt rosanna baker is based at catterick and during the three month , 1,000-mile expedition , will face temperatures of -40 degrees .
another member of the team is maj nat taylor :
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: appeal over fatal motorbike crash
text: south yorkshire police are urging a motorcyclist who may have witnessed a fatal collision involving another bike in rotherham at the weekend to come forward .
a motorcycle and a car collided on worry goose lane , whiston , near to the junction with greystones road , at about 12:50 on saturday 18 february .
the rider of the motorbike , peter heard ( 65 , of rotherham , was taken to northern general hospital with life threatening injuries and died a short time later .
anyone with information is being asked to call 101 .

documents.title: doncaster 's houghton out for the season
text: doncaster 's houghton out for the season

documents.title: dozen-pupil school to close in july
text: dozen-pupil school to close in july

documents.title: sofa shop on stilts
text: calderdale council have concluded their planning meeting looking at the application for a furniture store on stilts to replace one hit by the boxing day floods of 2015 in mytholmroyd , near halifax in west yorkshire .
it was approved by the council this afternoon , but it 's not known at present when the work will begin .
author: Len Tingle
Political Editor, BBC Look North

documents.title: breakingnine years behind bars for doncaster rapist
text: a 43-year-old man has been jailed for nine years after admitting raping and sexually assaulting a doncaster teenager , resulting in her becoming pregnant with his child .
glen sambrook of palm grove in conisborough appeared at sheffield crown court and pleaded guilty to 11 offences .
although sambrook has accepted responsibility for his awful crimes , this does not detract from the significant impact this abuse has had on his victim . ''

documents.title: paul nuttall hillsborough claims : a 'wider smear campaign '
text: the ukip leader , paul nuttall says there 's a 'smear campaign ' against him .
it follows an apology from mr nuttall over the resignations of two party chairmen in liverpool .
they had accused him and the party donor , arron banks of showing what they called .
'crass insensitivity ' towards the hillsborough disaster .
this in turn was triggered by false suggestions on his website that he 'd lost close friends in the crush during an fa cup semi-final at sheffield wednesday 's ground in april 1989 .
he says he 's done nothing to warrant such criticism .
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: carnegie sign arscott after sale sacking
text: carnegie sign arscott after sale sacking

documents.title: park hill flats documentary
text: i 've been hearing about a sheffield student who is seeking help from former residents of sheffield 's park hill flats .
edward brooks is hoping to make a documentary about the landmark development which has dominated the skyline behind the railway station since the the 1960s .
he says contributors will be able watch it online :
author: Paulette Edwards
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: to show man city v huddersfield
text: to show man city v huddersfield

documents.title: man , 20 , dies after falling ill in vehicle in york
text: a 20-year-old man has died after falling ill in a vehicle on the outskirts of york .
a spokesperson for north yorkshire police said officers were called to the `` sudden death '' at 4.40pm on monday .
it happened at traffic lights at the fulford interchange .
author: The Press

documents.title: watch : a tour round north yorkshire 's new £ 1.4bn incinerator
text: if you drive regularly on the a1 near knaresborough you may be wondering what the rather large edifice on the horizon is .
wonder no more - .
allerton park is the site of a huge incinerator at the heart of a new waste recovery park costing £ 1.4bn .
the incinerator begins operation in january 2018 but bbc radio york was given an exclusive tour round the facility :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police increase patrols after sheffield shooting
text: police are increasing patrols in an area where a man was fatally shot at the weekend .
south yorkshire police says more officers will be in place to reassure the community and gather witness information following the shooting of 23-year-old assel al-essaie at the weekend .
he was taken to hospital and died a short time after being shot .
detectives and local officers have been working relentlessly over the last few days to gather as much information as they can about this incident . ''
anyone with information is being asked to call 101 or ring crimestoppers to pass on information anonymously .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: breakingjo cox anniversary event hoping for 10 million participants
text: the widower of the murdered labour mp , jo cox , has announced that a special weekend event will be held this summer , to mark the first anniversary of her killing .
the event , called `` the great get together '' will take place on 17/18 june .
brendan cox wants the event to celebrate his late wife 's energy and her desire to bring communities together .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: watch : sheffield man 's 150-mile arctic run for charity
text: i 've been to the peak district to meet will roberts from sheffield .
he 's gone from nine pints and a kebab on a week night to running 150 miles across the arctic to raise money for an ms charity helping his mum .
hats off to him ( and good luck ! ) .
ms society uk
author: Mark Ansell
BBC Look North reporter

documents.title: allerton park incinerator will replace nearby landfill site
text: one of north yorkshire 's biggest landfill sites will close when the county 's new waste incinerator opens .
a huge amount of waste is currently delivered to allerton park landfill site near knaresborough .
but there are plans to mothball it when the nearby waste recovery park is up and running next year .
head of construction at the incinerator is mark james - he says it wo n't replace recycling schemes :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: getting under the skin of the real 'forensic ' scientists
text: if you 're a fan of tv shows like silent witness and csi then you may be interested in what the ripon workhouse museum has in store this weekend .
on saturday , tim thompson , professor of forensic anthropology at teesside university will be presenting a talk & skeleton workshop .
i spoke to tim earlier on the bbc radio york and asked him what the term `` forensics '' actually means :
author: Jonathan Cowap
Presenter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: listen : south yorkshire mp 's personal experience of alcoholic parents
text: one of south yorkshire 's mps is campaigning to get more support for children whose parents are alcoholics .
labour mp for don valley , caroline flint is part of a cross-party group of politicians working on the issue .
ms flint has said she grew up with an alcoholic mother and had to leave home at the age of 17 when the situation worsened as she prepared for her a-levels .
she says that while there 's help available for drinkers to overcome their problem , the children are being overlooked :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lgbt open day at halifax rufc
text: halifax rugby union football club are to host a taster rugby day aimed at encouraging the lgbt community to play the sport .
the open day will be held on saturday , 4 march at the club 's ovenden park ground .
the event is supported by the rugby football union ( rfu ) and gay rights organisation stonewall .
fiona armstrong is halifax 's safeguarding officer as well as a prop forward in the ladies team :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ritz in london says the ritz in brighouse has to drop its name
text: a brighouse music venue may be forced to shut its doors because a top london hotel says it must change its name .
the ritz hotel in london has written to the ritz in brighouse saying it must drop the name by february 28 or it will take legal action .
author: Huddersfield Examiner

documents.title: uncertain future for two west yorkshire hospitals
text: nearly two-thirds of local plans to transform nhs services in england involve hospital closures or downgrading a & e facilities .
that includes proposed changes at huddersfield royal infirmary and dewsbury hospital .
the ideas are designed to get more patients treated in their local communities .
chris ham is the chief executive of think tank , the king 's fund .
he says the proposals offer the best hope for the nhs but believes the aim of cutting beds is n't credible :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lydia pedalling her way to glory at world transplant games
text: a teenage cyclist , born with progressive terminal liver disease , is going to compete at the world transplant games in malaga .
16-year-old lydia mellen from york had a transplant ten years ago and is now a keen sportswoman , coached by her dad richard .
they spoke to me earlier on the bbc radio york breakfast show about the prospect of lydia turning out in team gb colours :
she heads out to malaga in june for the women 's 5km time trial .
author: Kay Crewdson
BBC Radio York

documents.title: match ban for teenagers after 'horrendous ' minibus attack on york fans
text: two teenage boys from barrow have been given five-year football banning orders after pleading guilty to throwing rocks at a minibus carrying women and children .
the boys , aged 15 and 16 , can not be named because of their age .

witnesses said a group of youths hurled rocks at the minibus as it travelled along the a590 walney road after the national league match on saturday 24 september 2016 at barrow 's holker street ground .
the attack led to two york supporters being taken to hospital with head injuries .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'stampede ' display on list for award
text: remember the frozen stampede in sheffield last summer when 50 elephant statues were displayed across the city ?
it was all to raise money for the sheffield children 's hospital charity and the scheme has been short-listed for a local award .
sheffield children 's
sheffchildrens
the @ twitterid has been nominated for an @ twitterid award - thanks to all who voted ! !
twitter.com/i/web/status/8
the @ twitterid has been nominated for an @ twitterid award - thanks to all who voted !
the @ twitterid has been nominated for an @ twitterid award - thanks to all who voted !
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: here come the girls
text: a musical based on north yorkshire 's calendar girls has an official opening in london 's west end tonight .
it 's called `` the girls '' , with music written by gary barlow and is based on the story of the middle-aged women from the rylstone wi who stripped off for a charity calendar .
york actor josh benson plays tommo and is hoping the stage version matches the success of the 2003 film .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: drugs seized in rotherham
text: two hundred cannabis plants have been seized by police in south yorkshire .
the plants will now be destroyed by an incinerator .
abdul aziz
inspectoraziz
all of this is on it 's way to the incinerator thanks to officers robson & hancock from # arotalpt .
investigation co twitter.com/i/web/status/8

investigation continues @ twitterid

documents.title: keighley 's muhammad ali aims to sting french boxers
text: keighley 's olympic boxer muhammad ali ( below ) has been named in the british lionhearts team for the second fixture of the season in the world series of boxing .
the lionhearts face france fighting roosters in paris on thursday .
the team is made-up of members of the gb boxing squad and a number of international selections , overseen by performance director , rob mccracken who also runs the gb boxing olympic programme .
muhammad is hoping he can help secure the lionhearts ' first win of the new campaign after they started the season with a narrow 3-2 defeat away to italia thunder .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: crofton and hs2 : people 'worried about their homes '
text: the planned hs2 rail line will destroy inheritances for west yorkshire 's future generations , it 's being claimed .
that 's the claim being made by members of the campaign group , crofton against hs2 .
hs2 limited - who will build the track - say the project will provide opportunities like jobs and apprenticeships .
local cleric and group member , rev louise tinniswood , says that so far , all hs2 has brought to crofton , near wakefield , is stress :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police aware of community concerns over gun deaths
text: south yorkshire police has issued an update this morning following the death of a 23-year-old man who was fatally shot in a sheffield street at the weekend .
assel al-essaie was shot as his family gathered for a celebration on saturday lunchtime .
he was taken to sheffield 's northern general hospital but died soon afterwards .

the shooting is the latest in a spate across the city since the start of the year but det ch insp steve whittaker said : `` we are aware that there are growing concerns in the local community and across sheffield following a number of separate reported shootings . ''
at this stage in our investigation , we do n't believe the murder of mr al-essaie is linked to any other reports in sheffield but we will of course explore every available line of inquiry . ''

documents.title: mining-damaged home claims 'ignored '
text: mining-damaged home claims 'ignored '

documents.title: meet yorkshire 's therapy meerkats
text: meet yorkshire 's therapy meerkats

documents.title: mp pounding streets for age uk charity
text: if you spot rother valley mp kevin barron in his lycra over the next few weeks , then chances are it 's because of his latest challenge .
he 's decided to run the london marathon in april to raise money for age uk rotherham and says that training is already 'going well ' .
kevin barron mp
kevinbarronmp
it has been announced , so i suppose there is no turning back .
i will be running @ twitterid for @ twitterid rotherhamadvertiser.co.uk/news/view , mp-s
it has been announced , so i suppose there is no turning back .
i will be running @ twitterid for @ twitterid
you 'd be better off giving that money to childline after what your town has done to a generation of children
guess i will have to sponsor you , forms at your office ?
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: low-attendance dales school could close early
text: officials are to due to make a decision on whether to act on a recommendation to close a north yorkshire school ahead of schedule .
horton-in-ribblesdale primary school , near settle , currently has just 15 pupils and it 's forecast the number of children could fall to as low as six over the next five years .
the parish council hopes the school can stay open until the end of the academic year , rather than close in april as is currently scheduled .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nhs boss : 'health tourist bills not a major problem '
text: unpaid bills from so-called `` health tourists '' have cost hospital trusts across north yorkshire nearly £ 1m over the last five years .
most of that figure is owed to the south tees nhs foundation trust which runs the friarage hospital in northallerton .
harrogate has written off over £ 16,000 over the last five years .
the trust is also owed £ 50,000 for this financial year and £ 8,400 for the previous financial year .
the york teaching hospital nhs foundation trust which runs york and scarborough hospitals is still owed more than £ 127,000 .
chief executive patrick crowley believes the amount owed is a relatively small figure for an organisation with a turnover of £ 500m :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: south yorkshire lord calls for second eu referendum
text: a south yorkshire lord tells me that he 'll be voting against his party over the brexit bill .
labour 's lord ahmed of rotherham , who voted to leave the eu , says he will back the lib dems in the lords to call for a second referendum .
peers in the house of lords will continue to talk about the brexit bill today .
lord ahmed told us there 's much more to debate .
author: Toby Foster
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: cute lamb alert !
text: it 's tough being a reporter at times , especially when i have to spend the morning at cannon hall farm near barnsley to see if there are any baby lambs .
no live births yet but if that changes i 'll let you know !
here 's a video i took earlier of baby roge who was born recently at the farm .
i have fallen in this morning .
meet little roge .
named after his fav person @ twitterid farmer roger !
@ twitterid @ twitterid bet he 's less trouble than andrew as well
awwwwwwww !
author: Kat Cowan
Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: one-punch killer 's 11-year sentence welcomed by campaigners
text: a man who killed a primary school teacher in doncaster with a single punch is starting an 11 year prison sentence .
lewis siddall , 24 , died after an unprovoked attack in a bar in august 2015 .
blue horrobin was found guilty of his manslaughter last month .
the length of his sentence has been welcomed by ann bartlett , who founded the campaign group `` one punch can kill you '' after her 21-year-old son was killed by a single punch eight years ago :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rush hour building across county
text: heavy traffic on a643 northbound at a58 gelderd road .
author: BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: slow traffic on m62 this morning
text: very slow traffic due to earlier accident on m62 eastbound between j27 m621 / a650 / a62 ( gildersome ) and j28 a650 / a653 ( tingley ) , congestion on m62 to j25 a644 ( brighouse ) .
author: BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: here 's lisa gallagher with the weather forecast for tuesday
text: here 's lisa gallagher with our weather forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: yorkshire sport news this morning
text: huddersfield town ( manager david wagner below ) can close the gap on the championship 's top two sides to four points , if they can beat promotion rivals reading at the john smith 's stadium tonight .
meanwhile , championship promotion rivals sheffield wednesday are looking to make it five wins in a row tonight as they host brentford at hillsborough .
york city can move to within three points of national league safety if they beat gateshead at bootham crescent tonight .
the match is city 's game in hand on those around them in the relegation zone .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the early headlines from our newsrooms across yorkshire include :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: i 'll be with you until 14:00 with all the latest news , travel and weather from across yorkshire .
we 'd love to see your like this close-up shot taken in thorne , near doncaster , sent in by bbc weather watcher dotty .
you can get in touch and send your photos via twitter , facebook or email .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live
